IRS990.MissionDesc: ARC BROWARD, INC. D/B/A ARC BROWARD IS A NOT-FOR-PROFIT CORPORATION ORGANIZED FOR THE PURPOSE OF PROVIDING THERAPEUTIC, EDUCATIONAL, VOCATIONAL, RESIDENTIAL AND OTHER RELATED SERVICES TO INDIVIDUALS WITH DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES AND OTHER (CONTINUED ON SCHEDULE O)
IRS990.Desc: ADULT SERVICES: THE ORGANIZATION OPERATES A VARIETY OF SERVICES FOR ADULTS WITH DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES INCLUDING OWNING FIVE GROUP HOMES LOCATED IN SINGLE FAMILY NEIGHBORHOODS IN SEVERAL CITIES IN BROWARD COUNTY, FLORIDA. UP TO SIX ADULTS OCCUPY EACH HOME. CERTAIN HOMES HAVE LIVE-IN STAFF WHILE OTHERS HAVE STAFF THAT PROVIDE 24 HOUR COVERAGE. The organization offers a continuum of day services to approximately 170 adults with developmental disabilities, including those with complex behavioral needs or those who are aging. Currently, the three specialized day programs provide meaningful activities that promote health & wellness, independent living, fine arts (CONTINUED ON SCHEDULE O)

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: THE ORGANIZATION OPERATES FORWARD THINKING SOCIAL ENTERPRISES WHICH ARE DESIGNED TO GENERATE NEEDED FUNDS TO SUPPORT OTHER SERVICES OF THE ORGANIZATION. THESE ENTERPRISES educate AND/OR EMPLOY GRADUATES OF THE ORGANIZATION'S POST-SECONDARY PROGRAMS. THESE INCLUDE ARC EDUCATES AND ARC CULINARY AND ARE DESCRIBED BELOW: ARC EDUCATES: ARC EDUCATES IS DEDICATED TO SUPPORTING INDIVIDUALS THROUGH QUALITY, AFFORDABLE PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT TRAINING AND EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS. THE MISSION IS TO EDUCATE and SUPPORT INDIVIDUALS AS THEY DEVELOP INTO life-long learners. (Continued ON Schedule O)

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: CHILDREN'S SERVICES: THE ORGANIZATION PROVIDES SEVERAL CENTER BASED PROGRAMS FOR CHILDREN AND YOUTH FROM THE AGES OF 3 TO 21 INCLUDING PRESCHOOL SERVICES, REHABILITATION (OCCUPATIONAL, PHYSICAL AND SPEECH THERAPY), AFTER-SCHOOL AND SUMMER CAMP. THESE PROGRAMS ARE HIGHLY STRUCTURED AND SPECIALIZED AND GENERALLY SUPPORT CHILDREN WITH DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES, MOSTLY WITH MEDICAL AND/OR BEHAVIORAL CHALLENGES. THE ORGANIZATION ALSO PROVIDES IN HOME SUPPORTIVE SERVICES SUCH AS RESPITE CARE AND DEVELOPMENTAL PARENT TRAINING (PARENTS AS TEACHERS). IN RESPONSE TO THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC, THESE SERVICES WERE PERFORMED IN-PERSON AS WELL AS VIRTUALLY DURING THE FISCAL YEAR.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION RECOGNIZES AND MEASURES TAX POSITIONS BASED ON THEIR TECHNICAL MERIT AND ASSESSES THE LIKELIHOOD THAT THE POSITIONS WILL BE SUSTAINED UPON EXAMINATION BASED ON THE FACTS, CIRCUMSTANCES AND INFORMATION AVAILABLE AT THE END OF EACH PERIOD. INTEREST AND PENALTIES ON TAX LIABILITIES, IF ANY, WOULD BE RECORDED IN INTEREST EXPENSE AND OTHER NON-INTEREST EXPENSE, RESPECTIVELY. THE ORGANIZATION DOES NOT BELIEVE IT HAS TAKEN ANY MATERIAL UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS AND, ACCORDINGLY, IT HAS NOT RECORDED ANY LIABILITIES FOR UNRECOGNIZED TAX BENEFITS. THE ORGANIZATION IS SUBJECT TO ROUTINE AUDITS BY A TAXING AUTHORITY. As of September 30, 2022 and 2021, the Organization was not subject to any examination by a taxing authority.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART I, LINE 1, DESCRIPTION OF ORGANIZATION MISSION:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION SERVED NEARLY 1,200 INDIVIDUALS FROM THOSE WHO ARE EXTREMELY BEHAVIORALLY CHALLENGED TO THOSE WHO ARE PREPARING TO ENTER THE WORKFORCE; IT PUBLISHES NUMEROUS INFORMATIONAL BROCHURES, NEWSLETTERS AND A WEBSITE AT WWW.ARCBROWARD.COM AND HAS A ROBUST SOCIAL MEDIA PRESENCE INCLUDING FACEBOOK, YOUTUBE, TWITTER, LINKED-IN, INSTAGRAM ETC. THE ORGANIZATION IS A REGIONAL LEADER, PROVIDING THE SERVICES NEEDED TO HELP CHILDREN AND ADULTS WITH DISABILITIES AND OTHER LIFE CHALLENGES TO ACHIEVE THEIR EDUCATIONAL, CAREER AND PERSONAL GOALS. THE ORGANIZATION OPERATES A CONTINUUM OF DIVERSE PROGRAMS FOR CHILDREN, YOUTH, ADULTS AND SENIORS. THE ORGANIZATION HAS A DEDICATED AND EXPERIENCED LEADERSHIP TEAM THAT IS ENDLESSLY MISSION-DRIVEN. THE ORGANIZATION HAS BEEN NATIONALLY ACCREDITED BY CARF, THE COMMISSION ON ACCREDITATION OF REHABILITATION FACILITIES, FOR 33 YEARS. IT IS LICENSED BY A MULTITUDE OF ENTITIES IN THE VARIOUS PROGRAMS AND SOCIAL ENTERPRISES INCLUDING CHILDCARE LICENSING, FLORIDA DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND FLORIDA DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION. IN AUGUST 2019, ARC EDUCATES RECEIVED ACCREDITATION FROM THE ACCREDITING COUNCIL FOR CONTINUING EDUCATION AND TRAINING (ACCET).

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART III, LINE 1, DESCRIPTION OF ORGANIZATION MISSION:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: LIFE CHALLENGES. ARC BROWARD IS A REGIONAL LEADER, PROVIDING THE SERVICES NEEDED TO HELP CHILDREN AND ADULTS WITH DISABILITIES AND OTHER LIFE CHALLENGES TO ACHIEVE THEIR EDUCATIONAL, CAREER AND PERSONAL GOALS. THE ORGANIZATION OPERATES A CONTINUUM OF DIVERSE PROGRAMS FOR CHILDREN, YOUTH, ADULTS AND SENIORS. THE ORGANIZATION HAS A DEDICATED AND EXPERIENCED LEADERSHIP TEAM THAT IS ENDLESSLY MISSION-DRIVEN. THE ORGANIZATION HAS BEEN NATIONALLY ACCREDITED BY CARF, THE COMMISSION ON ACCREDITATION OF REHABILITATION FACILITIES, FOR 33 YEARS. IT IS LICENSED BY A MULTITUDE OF ENTITIES IN THE VARIOUS PROGRAMS AND SOCIAL ENTERPRISES INCLUDING CHILDCARE LICENSING, FLORIDA DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND FLORIDA DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION. IN AUGUST 2019, ARC EDUCATES RECEIVED ACCREDITATION FROM THE ACCREDITING COUNCIL FOR CONTINUING EDUCATION AND TRAINING (ACCET).

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART III, LINE 4A, PROGRAM SERVICE ACCOMPLISHMENT:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: INSTRUCTION AS WELL AS PROVIDING WELL COORDINATED BEHAVIORAL, MEDICAL AND SOCIAL SERVICE SUPPORTS. IN RESPONSE TO THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC, THE DAY PROGRAMS WERE PERFORMED IN-PERSON DURING THE FISCAL YEAR.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART III, LINE 4B, PROGRAM SERVICE ACCOMPLISHMENTS:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ARC EDUCATES SPECIALIZES IN PROGRAMS DESIGNED FOR INDIVIDUALS WHO WORK IN THE CULINARY ARTS, HUMAN SERVICES, material handling and animal care fields. ARC CULINARY: PROVIDES QUALITY, COMPETITIVELY PRICED CATERING SERVICES FOR A VARIETY OF OCCASIONS INCLUDING WEDDINGS, PARTIES AND BUSINESS LUNCHES. THE REVENUE GENERATED THROUGH THE NONPROFIT CATERING BUSINESS GOES DIRECTLY TO SUPPORT THE CULINARY JOB PLACEMENT PROGRAM, HELPING STUDENTS WITH DISABILITIES AND OTHER LIFE CHALLENGES TRANSFORM THEIR LIVES AND BUILD NEW FUTURES. ARC CULINARY ALSO BEGAN PROVIDING MANAGED FOOD SERVICES TO AGENCIES IN BROWARD COUNTY WHO SERVE PEOPLE WITH barriers. ARC CULINARY IS A FOUNDING MEMBER OF CATALYST KITCHENS, A NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS DEDICATED TO BREAKING THE CYCLE OF JOBLESSNESS, POVERTY AND HUNGER THROUGH A VARIETY OF FOOD RELATED/CULINARY PROGRAMS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART III, LINE 4D, OTHER PROGRAM SERVICES:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION SERVED NEARLY 1,200 INDIVIDUALS and IS A REGIONAL LEADER, PROVIDING THE SERVICES NEEDED TO HELP CHILDREN AND ADULTS WITH DISABILITIES AND OTHER LIFE CHALLENGES TO ACHIEVE THEIR EDUCATIONAL, CAREER AND PERSONAL GOALS. IN THE CURRENT FISCAL YEAR, THE AGENCY WAS PROUD TO RECEIVE THE GREATER SUNRISE (WESTON) CHAMBER BUSINESS HERO AWARD AND THE BROWARD COUNTY COMMISSION NATIONAL DISABILITIES EMPLOYMENT PROCLAMATION. EXPENSES: $ 714,248. INCLUDING GRANTS OF $ 0. REVENUE: $ 14,627.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FORM 990 WAS PREPARED BY CONTROLLER, CFO, PRESIDENT/CEO, AND THE INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTANTS. THE FORM 990 WAS GIVEN TO AND REVIEWED BY THE AUDIT AND FINANCE COMMITTEE AND THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS PRIOR TO BEING FINALIZED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: CONFLICTS ARE DISCLOSED AT EACH BOARD MEETING IF APPLICABLE AND SUCH IS INCLUDED IN THE OFFICIAL MINUTES OF EACH MEETING. AT THE BOARD'S ANNUAL MEETING, EACH BOARD MEMBER SIGNS THE CONFLICT POLICY AND ANY FURTHER DISCLOSURE REQUIRED BY THE BOARD MEMBERS IS PROVIDED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINES 15A/B:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: AN EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION POLICY HAS BEEN ADOPTED. A SELF-EVALUATION BY EXECUTIVE IS PROVIDED TO THE GOVERNANCE COMMITTEE IN ITS CAPACITY AS THE EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE; COMPARABLE COMPENSATION INFORMATION IS OBTAINED AND REVIEWED; FEEDBACK IS OBTAINED FROM ENTIRE GOVERNING BODY; WRITTEN REVIEW INCLUDES OBJECTIVE SCORING AND TEXT, GOALS AND OBJECTIVES, PROGRESS, SUCCESSION DISCUSSION; WRITTEN AND ORAL FEEDBACK IS PROVIDED, MINUTES INCLUDED SPECIFIC COMPENSATION ADJUSTMENTS, IF ANY AND ARE SIGNED BY BOARD CHAIR ALONG WITH A WRITTEN PAYROLL CHANGE NOTICE FOR PROCESSING ANY ADJUSTMENTS. THE CEO PERFORMS A REVIEW OF OTHER KEY EMPLOYEES AFTER RECEIVING WRITTEN SELF-EVALUATION FROM EACH; OBJECTIVE SCORING AND WRITTEN FEEDBACK IS PROVIDED ALONG WITH GOALS AND OBJECTIVES; ORAL FEEDBACK IS PROVIDED, SIGNATURES OBTAINED OF EMPLOYEE AND CEO; WRITTEN PAYROLL CHANGE NOTICE FORM IS USED TO DIRECT ANY ADJUSTMENT IN COMPENSATION, TITLE, HOURS, ETC. COMPARABILITY DATA IS INFORMAL BUT CONSIDERED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19:

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S OVERSIGHT PROCESS FOR ITS ANNUAL AUDIT AND SELECTION PROCESS FOR ITS INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTANT HAS NOT CHANGED FROM THE PREVIOUS YEAR.
